sources.title: Highway Hell
sources.description: “Not surprisingly it’s crap” (IMDB review quote). Highway hookers in laughably awful early-forties exploitation. A low-budget anti-classic with a cast of acting class washouts that will make you long for an Ed Wood movie -- any Ed Wood movie! Don’t say you weren’t warned. IMDB rating 4.4. Produced and Directed by Patrick Carlyle. Released in 1941 Complete print (unfortunately) AKA “Hitchhike to Hell” “Going My Way, Mister?” “Highway Girls”

metadata.Plot: Charlie Sykes and his girlfriend Rachel Clark are traveling to Las Vegas to secretly get married to each other. The decide to follow through a secondary road, and while fueling their car in "Sam's Last Chance" gas station, they are advised by the owner and attendant Sam to not sleep after the second tree in the road. They fall asleep in the car, and a policeman arrests Rachel. Charlie returns to the gas station, and Sam tells him that she has been arrested by a Hellcop, and he has to go to hell if he wants to rescue his fiancée.
metadata.Actors: Patrick Bergin, Adam Storke, Chad Lowe
